results.title: A Corn husk doll by Deanna Skye
results.creator_credit: B T Film-Sound, National Indian Arts and Crafts and Geoff Voyce
results.brief_description: Deanna Skye, a Cayuga Indian, is one of the few that still carries on the beautiful craft of making corn husk dolls using materials gathered from nature. Pause for a while with an Indian mother as she makes a corn husk doll for her child.
results.title_for_label: A Corn husk doll by Deanna Skye

results.title: A Conversation with Walter Gropius and Frederic Day
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films, National Broadcasting Company and Robert D. Graff
results.brief_description: An interview with Walter Gropius, architect and founder of the Bauhaus School of Design and chairman of the Department of Architecture at the Graduate School of Design, Havard University. Gropius discusses his views and theories on architecture and design. An exponent of teamwork, Gropius founded the Bauhaus School in Dessau on the notion of collaboration between designers and artisans. By combining theory and practice, the school equipped students with the skills to develop a project from the design stage to production. Marcel Breuer and Mies van der Rohe were graduates of the school while Paul Klee was amongst the teaching staff. Gropius also discusses his views on architecture, stressing the need for designers to consider the spiritual and mental wellbeing of humans when developing functional spaces. Photographed by Jesse Sabin and Joe Vadala. Sound by Jerry Gold. Edited by Robert Loweree.

results.title: A Conversation with Jawaharlal Nehru and Chester Bowles
results.creator_credit: National Broadcasting Company and Robert D. Graff
results.brief_description: The Prime Minister of India, statesman and leader of the awakening nations of Asia - discusses his career and world events with Chester Bowles, former US Ambassador to India. He describes his early life, his friendship with Gandhi, and the fight for freedom. he also expresses his views on the problems India was facing in the 1960’s.
results.title_for_label: A Conversation with Jawaharlal Nehru and Chester Bowles
results.creator_credit_for_label: National Broadcasting Company and Robert D. Graff

results.title: A Conversation with Frank Lloyd Wright
results.brief_description: One of the world’s most original and influential architects discusses his theories of functional architecture and analyses contemporary styles. In a conversation covering a broad range of topics, Mr Wright displays the agile wit and eloquence that have made him one of the most colourful personalities of our time.

results.title: A Conversation with B.F. Skinner (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: McGraw-Hill Films, CRM Educational Films and Peter Jordan
results.brief_description: In his book Beyond Freedom and Dignity, Dr. B. F. Skinner rejects the general belief that within each individual there is an “inner man” immune to environmental shaping. In discussion with Elizabeth Hall of Psychology Today magazine, he illuminates the origins of behaviorism and some of its basic principles and argues the need for a culture designed by behaviorists. Within this context, he explores the notion of control, its use and potential misuse, punishment and freedom.

results.title: A Continuing responsibility
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, John Kemeny, Barrie Howells and Bonnie Sherr Klein
results.brief_description: Produced as part of the Challenge for Change Program, this series examines Saul Alinsky’s method of organising communities into effective action units based on participation democracy. As demonstrated in the Woodland Organisation in Chicago, Alinsky’s technique creates ongoing organisations firmly rooted in the community.

results.title: A Connecticut yankee in King Arthur's court
results.brief_description: In this imaginative story by Mark Twain, a modern man suddenly finds himself in the kingdom of King Arthur when he receives a blow to the head. Twain very cleverly compares the two eras customs and attitudes through this entertaining fantasy as the modern Yankee has fun introducing modern innovations to Arthur’s kingdom. No other production details available.

results.title: A Conceptual approach to teaching
results.creator_credit: South Australian Film Corporation, Education Dept of South Australia, Malcolm Smith and Ron Saunders
results.brief_description: The problems presented by what is popularly called “the information explosion” are no more keenly felt than by teachers and students. This film appraises current teaching methodology and provides a basis for discussion to provoke new thoughts and ideas on teaching techniques. Designed as an in-service aid for re-assessing and re-evaluating teaching programs and methodologies and provide a starting point for curriculum development.

results.title: A Computer glossary, or, coming to terms with the data processing machine
results.creator_credit: IBM, Bill Lightfield, Richard Spies, Charles Eames and Ray Eames
results.brief_description: Beginning with a journey along a computer data path, this films uses a variety of visual techniques to illustrate terms such as software, program, flow, subroutine, mnemonic, language, boolean logic, nanosecond, simulation, pattern recognition and algorithm. Emphasises the challenge of computer programming that emerges from its precisely defined procedures. Music by Elmer Bernstein.
